sessions.objective: Design and build dev-track from concept to working prototype
discovered: UI has never been rendered in browser — critical unknown
Integration plugins untested with real API keys
Kanban dnd-kit imported but not wired up
sessions.next_session_suggestion: Boot the UI (npm run dev), fix everything broken, then use the tool to manage its own next iteration.
sessions.handoff_message: Built 79 files from scratch in one session. Server boots clean. Codebase scanner works (tested on Pillar). Everything else needs browser testing. The tool is now set up to track its own development — all ideas, backlog, issues, and brain notes populated from the design conversation.

sessions.objective: First boot — get dev-track running and validate UI rendering

shipped.title: Fixed Tailwind/PostCSS config for Vite root resolution
Fixed codebase scanner default root (was scanning all Projects/)
All 11 UI views confirmed rendering in Chrome
GitHub repo created and all code pushed
Cursor rule cold-start fix for AI auto-orientation
Full project state update: session log, changelog, issues, brain notes, ideas

discovered: Cursor built-in browser doesn't work well with Vite/WebSocket — Chrome required
AI did not follow dev-track cursor rule proactively — cold-start instructions were missing
Codebase scanner was scanning parent directory (all of Projects/) instead of dev-track
Multi-user/concurrent session support needed for web-based future
sessions.next_session_suggestion: Test the cold-start cursor rule in a fresh chat window. Then tackle ISS-002 (TypeScript build). Start using dev-track to manage a real Pillar development session.
sessions.handoff_message: UI works. GitHub repo live at coleguerin-cmd/dev-track. Critical ISS-001 resolved. Cursor rule now has cold-start instructions so next chat window will auto-orient. The AI should now be managing the project proactively from the first message. Remaining: TS build (ISS-002), integration testing (ISS-003), kanban DnD (ISS-004).
